title: How to Unsend a Sent Text Message on iPhone & Messaging Apps on Android

steps.title: Update to iOS 16.
steps.content: Update to iOS 16. The ability to unsend and edit text messages is a new feature of iOS 16, so you'll need to update your iPhone if you haven't already. To update, launch the Settings app and just tap General > Software Update . [2] X Research source If the update is available for your model, tap Download and Install to get it. The following iPhone models can receive the iOS 16 update: iPhone 14, Plus, Pro, & Pro Max iPhone 13, Mini, Pro, & Pro Max iPhone 12, Mini, Pro, & Pro Max iPhone 11, Pro, & Pro Max iPhone XS & XS Max iPhone XR iPhone X iPhone 8 & 8 Plus iPhone SE (2nd gen & later)

steps.title: Open a conversation in the Messages app.
steps.content: Open a conversation in the Messages app. Once your iPhone receives the iOS 16 update, you'll be able to unsend those embarrassing texts for up to 2 minutes after sending. [3] X Research source If it's been longer than 2 minutes, you won't have the option to unsend. You can, however, edit a message you've sent for up to 15 minutes. Unsending only works if both you and the recipient are using iMessages on iOS 16 or later. If the recipient is using iOS 15.6 or earlier, macOS 12 or earlier, has an Android, or is using SMS, the original message will remain in the conversation.

steps.title: Tap and hold the message you want to unsend.
steps.content: Tap and hold the message you want to unsend. In addition to the standard reactions you're used to seeing above the message, you'll now see a menu with additional options, including Undo Send. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Undo Send to recall the message.
steps.content: Tap Undo Send to recall the message. This removes the message from the conversation instantly. [5] X Research source Instead of the original message, both you and the original recipient will see a note that says "You unsent a message." While the message itself will no longer be visible, the recipient will know you've sent something and recalled it.

steps.title: Tap Edit if you can't undo the text.
steps.content: Tap Edit if you can't undo the text. If more than 2 minutes have passed since you've sent the message, you can edit the sent text. Unlike the Unsend option, the option to edit a sent message is available for 15 minutes after sending. Just long-press the message bubble, select Edit , make your changes, and tap the blue checkmark to save. [6] X Research source Editing a sent text is great for fixing typos, but keep in mind that anyone in the conversation can still read your original text by tapping Edited below the updated message.

steps.title: In most cases, you can't unsend a text message you've already sent on your Android.
steps.content: In most cases, you can't unsend a text message you've already sent on your Android. Once you send a text in your Android's built-in texting app, it's out of your hands. However, many third-party messaging apps have unsend features—if you're prone to firing off embarrassing texts by accident, try to do most of your texting in apps like WhatsApp , Instagram , or Facebook Messenger .

steps.title: Open the conversation that contains the message you want to delete.
steps.content: Open the conversation that contains the message you want to delete. If you sent a regrettable message in a WhatsApp chat on any platform, it'll be super easy to unsend it. [7] X Research source Nobody will see the message once you've unsent it—instead, they'll just see a brief note that says "This message was deleted."

steps.title: Long-press the message.
steps.content: Long-press the message. Several options will appear. If you want to delete multiple messages at once, tap additional messages after long-tapping the first one.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . A confirmation message will appear, asking if you want to delete the message for everyone in the chat. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete for Everyone.
steps.content: Tap Delete for Everyone . This permanently removes the message from the conversation. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Select a conversation in your Instagram inbox.
steps.content: Select a conversation in your Instagram inbox. If you've sent an Instagram DM that you wish you hadn't, you can easily unsend it at any time. Once you remove the message, there will be no trace if it anywhere in the conversation. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Long-press the message.
steps.content: Long-press the message. A few options will expand. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Unsend.
steps.content: Tap Unsend . You'll now be asked if you'd really like to unsend the message. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Unsend to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Unsend to confirm. This permanently removes the message from the conversation. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a chat in your Facebook Messenger inbox.
steps.content: Tap a chat in your Facebook Messenger inbox. Messenger's Unsend for Everyone feature makes it easy to quickly delete any regrettable messages you've sent. Start by opening the conversation that contains the message you want to unsend. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Long-press the message.
steps.content: Long-press the message. After a second or so, you'll see the option to unsend the message. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Unsend.
steps.content: Tap Unsend . Now you'll be given the option to unsend the message for everyone or just yourself. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Unsend for everyone.
steps.content: Tap Unsend for everyone . This permanently deletes the message from all sides of the conversation. [17] X Research source
